para: AMIDE currently supports two methods for aligning data sets to each other. They are described below.

step.para: First rotate each of the data sets so that they are level with respect to the transverse, coronal, and sagittal views. This is easily done using the shift-2, and shift-3 mouse combinations, but can also be done from the data set modification dialog.
Choose one of the data sets to be the active data set. The other data set will be the "fixed" data set.
Shift the active data set so that the two data sets line up appropriately. This is easily done using the shift-1 mouse combination, but can also be done from the data set modification dialog.
If fine tuning adjustments are needed, these are best done from the data set modification dialog.
Specify at least four pairs of alignment points between the two data sets that you wish to align. Drawing alignment points is described in
Run the alignment wizard (under tools->alignment wizard).

sect1.title: Drawing Alignment Points
sect1.para: Alignment points can be added to any of the data sets in the study. To add an alignment point, hit the "Edit->Add alignment point" menu item, which will add an alignment point to the currently active data set. Alternatively, hold down the shift button and press the right mouse button while hovering over a data set's name in the study list. In either case, you will then be prompted for a name for the alignment point, and the point will then be placed at the currently viewed location. The alignment point can be moved by clicking on the marker point shown in any of the views.

sect2.title: Alignment Point Modification Dialog Box
sect2.para: To modify parameters of an alignment point, first select and then right click the point in the study list. The Alignment Point Modification Dialog Box will then appear. Parameters that can be modified are listed below.

sect3.title: Basic Info
sect3.para: The name, and location of the alignment point can be altered on this page. Hitting the OK or Apply buttons will cause any changes made on this page to take effect. Hitting Close will quit the dialog without making any changes.
